summary: Audit found 2 contradictions: 1 internal contradiction between claims, 1 contradiction with established knowledge.

claims.text: TP53 is a tumor suppressor that prevents uncontrolled cell growth.
claims.support_span: TP53 is well-established as a tumor suppressor.

claims.text: TP53 promotes tumor formation and cancer progression.
BRAF V600E mutation is not associated with melanoma.

findings.message: Internal contradiction: claim-001 states TP53 is a tumor suppressor that prevents cell growth, while claim-002 states TP53 promotes tumor formation. These claims are mutually exclusive.

provenance.rule_name: Detect contradictory claims about same entity

suggested_fix.patch: Remove or correct claim-002. TP53 is a well-established tumor suppressor. Note: Gain-of-function TP53 mutants can have oncogenic properties, but wild-type TP53 suppresses tumors. Clarify whether referring to wild-type or mutant TP53.
suggested_fix.rationale: The two claims about TP53 function are contradictory. Claim-001 aligns with established knowledge.

findings.message: Contradiction with established knowledge: BRAF V600E is strongly associated with melanoma (found in ~50% of melanomas). The claim that it is 'not associated' contradicts extensive literature and clinical evidence.

suggested_fix.patch: Remove or invert this claim. BRAF V600E is one of the most common mutations in melanoma and is a validated therapeutic target (e.g., vemurafenib, dabrafenib).
suggested_fix.rationale: This claim directly contradicts well-established clinical knowledge with extensive evidence.
